title-part.text: IMAGE DATA PROCESSING OR GENERATION, IN GENERAL

note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
G06T1/40 covered by G06T1/20
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

CPC-specific-text.text: Image feed-back for automatic industrial control, e.g. robot with camera

reference.text: robots B25J19/023

CPC-specific-text.text: Adaptive watermarking, e.g. Human Visual System [HVS]-based watermarking
Fragile watermarking, e.g. so as to detect tampering
Robust watermarking, e.g. average attack or collusion attack resistant
Geometric transfor invariant watermarking, e.g. affine transform invariant
Time domain based watermarking, e.g. watermarks spread over several images
Payload characteristic determination in a watermarking scheme, e.g. number of bits to be embedded

title-part.text: Geometric image transformation in the plane of the image

reference.text: G06T3/4038, G06T3/0068 take precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: Context preserving transformation, e.g. by using an importance map

reference.text: G06T3/0062 takes precedence
G06T3/0018 takes precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: for topological mapping of a higher dimensional structure on a lower dimensional surface
Reshaping or unfolding a 3D tree structure onto a 2D plane
Surface of revolution to planar image transformation
for projecting an image on a non-planar surface, e.g. a geodetic screen
the transformation method being selected according to the characteristics of the input image
for image registration, e.g. elastic snapping
for image warping, i.e. transforming by individually repositioning each pixel

title-part.text: Linear translation of a whole image or part thereof, e.g. panning
Scaling the whole image or part thereof

reference.text: G06T3/4015, G06T3/403 take precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: Demosaicing, e.g. colour filter array [CFA], Bayer pattern
Decimation- or insertion-based scaling, e.g. pixel or line decimation
for image mosaicing, i.e. plane images composed of plane sub-images
Super resolution, i.e. output image resolution higher than sensor resolution
by injecting details from a different spectral band
by iteratively correcting the provisional high resolution image using the original low-resolution image
Transform-based scaling, e.g. FFT domain scaling
Image resolution transcoding, e.g. client/server architecture

title-part.text: Rotation of a whole image or part thereof

CPC-specific-text.text: Block rotation, e.g. by recursive reversing or rotating
using a CORDIC [COordinate Rotation Digital Compute] device
Rotation by memory addressing or mapping
Skewing or deskewing, e.g. by two-pass or three-pass rotation

reference.text: noise processing or correction adapted to be used in an image pickup device containing and electronic image sensor H04N5/217, H04N5/357 - H04N5/365
vibration or motion blur correction for cameras comprising an electronic image sensor H04N5/23264

detecting, correction, reducing or removing defects, e.g. non-responsive pixels of solid state image sensors H04N5/367, scratch removal for cinematographic films scanned by electronic image sensor H04N5/253

detecting, correcting, reducing or removing artefacts resulting only from the lens unit, e.g. flare, shading, vignetting or "cos4" H04N5/3572; correction of chromatic aberrations adapted to be used in an image pickup device containing an electronic image sensor H04N9/045
applied in cameras using an electronic image sensor H04N5/2355, H04N5/2356

CPC-specific-text.text: Global, i.e. based on properties of the image as a whole

reference.text: applied in cameras using an electronic image sensor H04N5/23229, H04N5/235
applied in cameras using an electronic image sensor H04N5/23229, H04N5/235, H04N5/253, H04N5/367

title-part.text: by the use of local operators

reference.text: applied in cameras using an electronic image sensor H04N5/23229, H04N5/235, H04N5/253, H04N5/367

title-part.text: by the use of histogram techniques

reference.text: applied in cameras using an electronic image sensor H04N5/23229, H04N5/235

title-part.text: by the use of more than one image, e.g. averaging, subtraction

reference.text: applied in cameras using an electronic image sensor H04N5/23229, H04N5/235

CPC-specific-text.text: Inspection of images, e.g. flaw detection

reference.text: motion-based segmentation G06T7/215

note.note-paragraph: When classifying in groups G06T7/11 - G06T7/13, classification is also made in relevant groups of G06T7/136 - G06T7/194.

title-part.text: involving probabilistic approaches, e.g. Markov random field [MRF] modelling
involving deformable models, e.g. active contour models
involving the use of two or more images

reference.text: motion estimation for coding, decoding, compressing or decompressing digital video signals H04N19/43, H04N19/51

title-part.text: for motion estimation over a hierarchy of resolutions

reference.text: multi-resolution motion estimation or hierarchical motion estimation for coding, decoding, compressing or decompressing digital video signals H04N19/53

title-part.text: using non-full search, e.g. three-step search
using feature-based methods, e.g. the tracking of corners or segments
using transform domain methods, e.g. Fourier domain methods
involving stochastic approaches, e.g. using Kalman filters
using a sequence of stereo image pairs
Determination of transform parameters for the alignment of images, i.e. image registration

reference.text: depth or shape recovery from texture G06T7/529

title-part.text: based on statistical description of texture
using image operators, e.g. filters, edge density metrics or local histograms
based on structural texture description, e.g. using primitives or placement rules

reference.text: G06T7/586 takes precedence

title-part.text: from laser ranging, e.g. using interferometry
from the projection of structured light
from perspective effects, e.g. by using vanishing points
from light fields, e.g. from plenoptic cameras
from multiple light sources, e.g. photometric stereo

CPC-specific-text.text: from three or more stereo images

title-part.text: of area, perimeter, diameter or volume
of image moments or centre of gravity
Determining position or orientation of objects or cameras

reference.text: camera calibration G06T7/80

title-part.text: Analysis of captured images to determine intrinsic or extrinsic camera parameters, i.e. camera calibration

reference.text: depth or shape recovery from multiple images G06T7/55; stereo camera calibration G06T7/85

bandwidth or redundancy reduction for static pictures H04N1/41; coding or decoding of static colour picture signals H04N1/64; methods or arrangements for coding, decoding, compressing or decompressing digital video signals H04N19/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Statistical coding, e.g. Huffman, run length coding
Transform coding, e.g. discrete cosine transform

title-part.text: Contour coding, e.g. using detection of edges

CPC-specific-text.text: Texturing; Colouring; Generation of texture or colour
Specific pre-processing for tomographic reconstruction, e.g. calibration, source positioning, rebinning, scatter correction, retrospective gating
Inverse problem, transformation from projection-space into object-space, e.g. transform methods, back-projection, algebraic methods
Specific post-processing after tomographic reconstruction, e.g. voxelisation, metal artifact correction

title-part.text: Drawing from basic elements, e.g. lines or circles

CPC-specific-text.text: Drawing of straight lines or curves

title-part.text: Filling a planar surface by adding surface attributes, e.g. colour or texture
Creating or modifying a manually drawn or painted image using a manual input device, e.g. mouse, light pen, direction keys on keyboard
of characters, e.g. humans, animals or virtual beings
of natural phenomena, e.g. rain, snow, water or plants
Three dimensional [3D] modelling, e.g. data description of 3D objects
Constructive solid geometry [CSG] using solid primitives, e.g. cylinders, cubes
Finite element generation, e.g. wire-frame surface description,
Manipulating 3D models or images for computer graphics

reference.text: object pose determination, tracking or camera calibration for mixed reality G06T7/00

title-part.text: Editing of 3D images, e.g. changing shapes or colours, aligning objects or positioning parts
Indexing scheme for image data processing or generation, in general
involving all processing steps from image acquisition to 3D model generation
involving adaptation to the client's capabilities
Embedding of the watermark in the spatial domain
Embedding of the watermark in the frequency domain
Embedding of the watermark in the coding stream, possibly without decoding
Embedding of the watermark in the compressed domain
Embedding of the watermark in each block of the image, e.g. segmented watermarking
Embedding of the watermark in text images, e.g. watermarking text documents using letter skew, letter distance or row distance
in relation to collusion attacks, e.g. collusion attack resistant
for copy protection or copy management, e.g. CGMS, copy only once, one-time copy
whereby both original and watermarked images are required at decoder, e.g. destination-based, non-blind, non-oblivious
whereby only watermarked image required at decoder, e.g. source-based, blind, oblivious
whereby only tamper or origin are detected and no embedding takes place
whereby the quality of watermarked images is measured
Measuring quality or performance of watermarking methods
whereby the image with embedded watermark is reverted to the original condition before embedding, e.g. lossless, distortion-free or invertible watermarking
whereby calibration information is embedded in the watermark, e.g. a grid, a scale, a list of transformations
Indexing scheme for image analysis or image enhancement
Concurrent acquisition with multiple different tomographic modalities
Hierarchical, coarse-to-fine, multiscale or multiresolution image processing
Dividing image into blocks, subimages or windows
Discrete and fast Fourier transform, [DFT, FFT]
Projection on vertical or horizontal image axis
Interactive image processing based on input by user
Interactive definition of curve of interest
Interactive definition of point of interest, landmark or seed
Interactive definition of region of interest [ROI]
Interactive selection of 2D slice in a 3D data set
Noise reduction or smoothing in the temporal domain
Centreline of tubular or elongated structure
Traffic on road, railway or crossing
Indexing scheme for image generation or computer graphics
Particle system, point based geometry or rendering
Curved planar reformation of 3D line structures
Using real world measurements to influence rendering
Indexing scheme for manipulating 3D models or images for computer graphics
Cut plane or projection plane definition
Indexing scheme for editing of 3D models
Aligning objects, relative positioning of parts
